chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Lamon S Clark was found guilty of OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Lamon S Clark was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant granted a payment plan of $50 per month for fine/costs commencing 4/1/2018. Failure to pay may result in a commitment of -1- day for every $25 owed.
Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08. If accepted, defendant may serve sentence in Sheboygan County.
Defendant to submit a DNA sample.

records.addlTxt: Jury trial list
Ct 1 & 2-Guilty
JOC from Racine and Sheboygan County
Hearing 9/5/2017  Exhibit 1 - DVD of Traffic stop (State) in DVD/CD Binder in file drawer.   Exhibits located in Exhibit Room FC 1-1

Atty. Shannon Whitworth appears for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant in person and by Atty. Daryl Laatsch. Counsel statements. Counsel prepared to proceed to trial on Ct. 1 & 2. Defendant will stipulated to Ct. 3 and will enter a plea.

  9:05 am   Jurors reported and given oath.
  9:07 am   18 Jurors called to jury box.
  9:14 am   Court voir dire of jury.
  9:28 am   Voir dire by Atty. Whitworth.
  9:35 am   Voir dire by Atty. Laatsch.
  9:37 am   Court further voir dire of jury.
  9:39 am   Counsel striking of jury.
  9:43 am   12 Jurors called to hear case. All other jurors thanked and excused.
  9:45 am   Jury sworn. Jury opening instructions.
  9:50 am   Jury recess/Court recess.
10:10 am   Opening statement by Atty. Whitworth.
10:15 am   Opening statement by Atty. Laatsch.
10:20 am   M.O. sworn and testified. Exam by Atty. Whitworth, crossexam by Atty. Laatsch.
10:25 am   Deputy Nicholas Depies sworn and testified. Exam by Atty. Whitworth, crossexam by Atty. Laatsch, redirect, recross.
11:28 am   K.G. sworn and testified. Exam by Atty. Whitworth, crossexam by Atty. Laatsch, crossexam by Atty. Laatsch, exam by Court.
11:40 am   Theodore Savage sworn and testified (WI Lab of Hygiene). Exam by Atty. Whitworth, crossexam by Atty. Laatsch.
12:05 pm   State rests subject to any housekeeping matters. 
12:06 pm   Jury excused for lunch recess to 1:30 pm.
 1:35  pm   Court in session. Court questions defendant on his right to testify.  
                    Court recess for jury instruction conference between counsel/clerk.
 1:45  pm   Jury in court/Defense rests.
 1:46  pm   Closing statement of Atty. Whitworth. 
 1:55  pm   Closing statement by Atty. Laatsch.
 2:08  pm   Rebuttal statement by Atty. Whitworth.
 2:10  pm   Court instructs jury.
 2:27  pm   Bailiff sworn.
 2:28  pm   Jury leaves for deliberation.
 2:30  pm   Court/counsel/defendant in court. Defendant enters guilty plea to Ct. 3. Court examines defendant and finds him guilty.
 2:45  pm   Court is informed verdict has been reached.
 2:52  pm   Court/counsel/jury/defendant in Court. Verdict read: Ct. 1-Guilty  Ct. 2-Guilty
 2:54  pm   Jury polled.
 2:55  pm   Jury thanked and excused.
 2:56  pm   Atty. Whitworth moves for judgment on the verdict. Court grants motion. Court orders Ct. 2 dismissed. 
                    Court reviews Judgment of Convictions on prior offenses and will move forward as 3rd offense OWI on this case.
                    Court renders sentence on Ct. 1 / Ct. 3.
